channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-12760] sun.misc.Cleaner has moved to a new location in OpenJDK 9
item.description:
This is a heads-up: there are upcoming changes in JDK 9 that will require, at least, a small update to org.apache.hadoop.crypto.CryptoStreamUtils & org.apache.hadoop.io.nativeio.NativeIO.

OpenJDK issue no. 8148117: "Move sun.misc.Cleaner to jdk.internal.ref" [1], will move the Cleaner class from sun.misc to jdk.internal.ref. There is ongoing discussion about the possibility of providing a public supported API, maybe in the JDK 9 timeframe, for releasing NIO direct buffer native memory, see the core-libs-dev mail thread [2]. At the very least CryptoStreamUtils & NativeIO [3] should be updated to have knowledge of the new location of the JDK Cleaner.

[1] https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8148117
[2] http://mail.openjdk.java.net/pipermail/core-libs-dev/2016-January/038243.html
[3] https://github.com/apache/hadoop/search?utf8=✓&q=sun.misc.Cleaner
item.summary: sun.misc.Cleaner has moved to a new location in OpenJDK 9

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Here is a sample patch. I ran 'mvn install -DskipTests' successfully in 9-ea+135.
This patch is inspired by Apache Lucene.
https://github.com/apache/lucene-solr/blob/master/lucene/core/src/java/org/apache/lucene/store/MMapDirectory.java

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.

With Java 9 build 148+ it changed more. Cleaner isn't available anymore. With build 150, LUCENE requested to add it back.

There is now a method in the legacy sun.misc.Unsafe to invoke the cleaner. See Lucene's MMapDirectory for a platform-independant unmapper: LUCENE-6989

Uwe: thanks for keeping us current with this; for now we are ignoring java 9, which is probably due to fear. I would like to get onto it just for the CP isolation though.

I can see we will need to do patches here; I'd put them into a self-contained static class so that they can be tested independently their actual uses.
Thanks Uwe. Updated the patch.

03: Cleaned up imports.

This message was automatically generated.
Are there any chance this will be available in Hadoop-3.0 ?

Zoltan: no; 3.0 isn't qualified against Java 9.

Akira: How ready is this to go in? I see its using introspection to do the cleaner stuff, so it is backwards compatible, right?

How ready is this to go in?

This implementation is inspired from LUCENE-6989. The hack code can be available at https://github.com/apache/lucene-solr/blob/master/lucene/core/src/java/org/apache/lucene/store/MMapDirectory.java#L339
Given Apache Lucene is Java 9 ready, the patch is ready to go in.

I see its using introspection to do the cleaner stuff, so it is backwards compatible, right?

Yes, it is backward compatible.

-1 overall

Looks close to getting in. And it's interesting to see how others are making use of Java 8 language features; we are all slowly learning our way around.

Two changes and then I think it's ready to commit

  • fix the checkstyle by adding a private ctor to CleanerUtil
  • L182: include the error as the cause of the new IOE, with its stack.
Thanks Steve for reviewing this. Updated the patch.

Hi ajisakaa, thanks for your work.

I have faced errors while building it.

[ERROR] ./hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/io/nativeio/NativeIO.java:359: Undefined reference: jdk.internal.ref.Cleaner
[ERROR] ./hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/crypto/CryptoStreamUtils.java:65: Undefined reference: jdk.internal.ref.Cleaner

Should we need to ignore jdk.internal.ref.Cleaner in animal-sniffer-maven-plugin?

Hi tasanuma0829, what command did you run to build Apache Hadoop?
I applied HADOOP-12760 and HDFS-11610 and ran mvn clean install -DskipTests.

ajisakaa Sorry, I made a mistake. I used "dev-support/bin/smart-apply-patch HADOOP-12760" but it didn't apply the latest patch. After applying the latest patch manually, the build succeeded. Sorry for confusing you.

Thank you for the clarification.

FYI

  • Now Apache Hadoop yetus-wrapper fetches Apache Yetus 0.4.0 by default and the smart-apply-patch is broken. (Fixed by YETUS-598)
  • Workaround: Set environment variable HADOOP_YETUS_VERSION to 0.7.0 and retry.
Oh, I understand. Thank you for sharing the information!

+1 (non-binding).

Hi stevel@apache.org, could you review the latest patch and HDFS-11610?  After merging the two patches, it would be easier to work on other Java 9 tasks.

ajisakaa, thanks for taking this up. Shall we keep existing approach for cases when java version is lower than 9.

CleanerUtil.java
public static void clean(ByteBuffer buffer) throws IOException {
if (IS_JAVA_VERSION_9) {
getCleaner().freeBuffer(buffer);
} else {
final sun.misc.Cleaner bufferCleaner = ((sun.nio.ch.DirectBuffer) buffer)
.cleaner();
bufferCleaner.clean();
}
}
* IS_JAVA_VERSION_9 is static variable referring to java version
Unfortunately, we cannot take the existing approach since sun.misc.Cleaner no longer exists in Java9. Compiling the above code fails by NoClassDefFoundError.

ajisakaa ya, it seems import statement used in above approach will throw NoClassDefFoundError. Working around that will be clunky as well. For patch v06 CryptoStreamUtils L43, shall we add a logging statement? (Considering a probable scenario when we can't free native memory using cleaner )
Thanks ajayydv. Updated the patch to add logging statements in CryptoStreamUtils and NativeIO when unmap failed.

+1. Thanks ajisakaa. Will commit it later today.

Committed to trunk. Thanks for the contribution, ajisakaa! Thanks for the comments and reviews, everyone!

Now we can package build on JDK9 without any patches.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #14942 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/14942/)
HADOOP-12760. sun.misc.Cleaner has moved to a new location in OpenJDK 9. (tasanuma: rev 5d084d7eca32cfa647a78ff6ed3c378659f5b186)

  • (add) hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/util/CleanerUtil.java
  • (edit) hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/crypto/CryptoStreamUtils.java
  • (edit) hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/io/nativeio/NativeIO.java
Thank you tasanuma0829!

ajisakaa,tasanuma0829, @all Awesome, thanks for all the hard work. Just wanted to reach out and say that I just build and tested Ozone with Java 9 and it works like a charm. Once more, Hats off for such amazing work.
